name: methyl_ethyl_sulfide
source: American Petroleum Institute. Research Project 44; Selected Values of Properties of Hydrocarbons and Related Compounds. Texas A & M University; College Station; TX; 1973.
Reason: 1,3-propanedithiol has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for this compound can be considered ethanethiol, which has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The ethyl group introduces a bulky structure, which can sterically hinder the sulfur atom, raising the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The sulfur atom introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius.
